key_features: Multi-line textarea input component wrapping Material UI TextField
Custom styled component with border radius and transition effects
Simplified onChange API (value string instead of event object)
Support for rows and maxRows configuration
Full TypeScript support with prop interfaces

patterns_discovered.description: TextareaInput wraps Material UI's TextField to provide simplified API and consistent styling with application design system
Uses @mui/material styled() to create StyledTextField with theme-aware styling including hover and focus states
TextareaInputProps extends TextInputBaseProps and omits onChange, while TextFieldProps omits controlled props to prevent conflicts
handleChange extracts string value from React.ChangeEvent to simplify component API and reduce boilerplate in consumers
Uses shared TextInputBaseProps for consistency across form input components (parallel to TextInput)

gotchas_discovered.description: TextFieldProps carefully omits controlled props (value, onChange, error, helperText, etc.) to prevent prop conflicts and confusion - consumers must use the component's own props for these
Component expects controlled value prop and onChange callback; uncontrolled usage will not work as Material UI TextField requires value prop
handleChange uses HTMLInputElement type, but multiline textarea technically uses HTMLTextAreaElement - works but technically different DOM element type
variant='outlined' is hard-coded and fullWidth is always true - no flexibility for consumers wanting different variants or responsive widths

approach_outcome.summary: TextareaInput component successfully created on first attempt with proper TypeScript interfaces, Material UI integration, custom styling with theme support, and simplified onChange API

recommendations.suggestion: Consider using HTMLTextAreaElement instead of HTMLInputElement in handleChange for more accurate typing, though current approach works due to event.target.value compatibility
Consider exposing variant prop (e.g., 'outlined' | 'filled' | 'standard') and fullWidth as component props for more consumer control
Add usage examples in component documentation showing rows/maxRows configuration and common textarea use cases
Verify TextareaInput styling (border radius: 8px, font size: 0.875rem) matches TextInput component for visual consistency across form inputs
